dataset.title: ANA01: Weekly Measurement of Precipitation Volume and Chemistry Collected as Part of the National Atmospheric Deposition Program

address.deliveryPoint: 116 Ackert Hall, Division of Biology, Kansas State University

section.para: Data set contains results of chemical analysis of wetfall on Konza Prairie. Analysis done by the Central Analytical Lab (CAL), Champaign, IL as part of the National Atmospheric Deposition Program (NADP). Data is coordinated by the NADP/NTN Coordination Office at Fort Collins, CO. Data products from that office include: Annual Data Summaries, Semiannual Data Reports, Annual and Seasonal Averages, Monthly Averages, and Weekly data. Konza Prairie LTER maintains the weekly data in electronic form (file name NADP in subdirectory nutrient) while other summaries are available via hard copy.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Alpha-numeric site identification code, first two characters of which are the abbreviation of the state in which the site is located (Konza Prairie Cal code is KS31)

attribute.attributeDefinition: volume of sample captured by the sample bucket in milliters
precipitation amount as measured by the rain gauge in millimeters. Trace amounts are indicated by -7.00
precipitation amount used by NADP/NTN in calculating weighted-mean concentrations, depositions and precipitation totals.
A code indicating the condition of the sample upon arrival at CAL

codeDefinition.definition: quality assurance sample submitted in lieu of a wet-side sample bucket for a week during which no precipitation occurred.
trace amount of less than approx. 10 ml; analyses are incomplete.
sample volume of approximately 35ml or more
sample volume less than 35 ml; dilution was required.

attribute.attributeDefinition: A code which indicated whether a sample is considered valid according to NADP/NTN data validation rules.

codeDefinition.definition: valid sample of lab type w
valid sample of lab type wa

attribute.attributeDefinition: A code which indicated whether a sample is considered invalid according to NADP/NTN data validation rules.

codeDefinition.definition: undefined sample (collector was open for > 6 hours and less than the entire sampling period when no precipitation was occuring.)

attribute.attributeDefinition: Coded summary of the CAL screening codes and remarks written on the Field Observer Report Form by field personnel, CAL staff, and coordination office staff.

codeDefinition.definition: bulk sample. Sample was continuously exposed to both wetfall and dryfall. (collector was open continuously.)
results are not yet available (predominantly dry samples)
information was never reported and will never be available.
no chemistry data will be reported because of extreme contaminations, undefined sampling protocol, leakage, loss in the mail, etc.
samples was collected at a nonapproved sampling site or with nonapproval equipment.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Season of summary period
Year of record
Data percentage of the summary period for which there are valid samples.
Percentage of the summary period for which precipitation amounts are available either from the rain gage or from the sample volume.
Percentage of the total measured precipitation associated with valid samples
Collection efficiency. This is the sum of the sample bucket depths (in centimeters) for all valid samples where (in centimeters) for all valid samples where both values are available.
